Content:
Hello everyone,

I bought my motorcycle a few months ago probably in June 2023 and it has never truly idled properly. I stalls on me quite frequently. I don’t ride it a lot for this reason, but I am not sure how to fix it and make it idle smoothly.
I recently pulled out the carburetor and cleaned the jets, I added new spark plugs cause those went bad as well and I got a new battery installed. I can start the bike and when I have the choke all the way out it’ll idle just fine. If I put the choke back in, it dies on me, unless I’m pulling the throttle. I can ride it just fine usually, but anytime I come to a stop or near stop it dies. So now it dies anytime I’m standing still on it.
Has anyone had these issues before? Should I mess with the idling PMS screws? I would do this, but they are capped off and this makes me believe the manufacturer doesn’t want them to be accessed. Should I clean the carburetor again?
Another interesting thing I found is that the throttle cable screw was all the way loose and held in place by a zip tie… not sure what that was about but hopefully it gives some extra info.
Anything helps, I just want to get it running smoothly hopefully.
Title: 2013 Yamaha V Star 650 not Idling Properly
Author: Fonsi98
